definition.name: NXlens_em
definition.doc:
Description of an electro-magnetic lens or a compound lens.
For NXtransformations the origin of the coordinate system is placed in the center of the lens (its polepiece, pinhole, or another point of reference). The origin should be specified in the NXtransformations.
For details of electro-magnetic lenses in the literature see e.g. `L. Reimer <https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-540-38967-5>`_

field.name: type
field.doc: Qualitative type of lens with respect to the number of pole pieces.

field.name: name
field.doc: Given name, alias, colloquial, or short name for the lens. For manufacturer names and identifiers use respective manufacturer fields.

field.name: manufacturer_name
field.doc: Name of the manufacturer who built/constructed the lens.

field.name: model
field.doc: Hardware name, hash identifier, or serial number that was given by the manufacturer to identify the lens.

field.name: description
field.doc: Ideally an identifier, persistent link, or free text which gives further details about the lens.

field.name: voltage
field.doc: Excitation voltage of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: current
field.doc: Excitation current of the lens. For dipoles it is a single number. For higher orders, it is an array.

field.name: value
field.doc: This field should be used when the exact voltage or current of the lens is not directly controllable as the control software of the microscope does not enable users/or is was not configured to enable the user to retrieve these values. In this case this field should be used to specify the value as read from the control software. Although consumers of the application definition should not expect this value to represent the exact physical voltage or excitation, it is still useful to know though as it allows other users to reuse this lens setting, which, provided a properly working instrument and software should bring the lenses into a similar state.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Specifies the position of the lens by pointing to the last transformation in the transformation chain in the NXtransformations group.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the lens as a component in the instrument. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.
